item.title: Systemd and shutdown
item.description: Here is a memo to make a Linux system shutdown smoothly and quickly. Quick workaround https://itsfoss.com/long-shutdown-linux/ Edit /etc/systemd/system.conf to reduce timeout from default 100s according to systemd-system.conf(5): DefaultTimeoutStartSec=, DefaultTimeoutStopSec=, DefaultTimeoutAbortSec=, DefaultRestartSec= Configures the default timeouts for starting, stopping and aborting of units, as well as the default time to sleep between automatic restarts of units, as configured per-unit in TimeoutStartSec=, TimeoutStopSec=, TimeoutAbortSec= and RestartSec= (for services, see systemd.service(5) for details on the per-unit settings).
